alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:38PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Huerfano and northeastern Costilla Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 233 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking weakening thunderstorms over northern Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...High flows possible through Pass, Oak and Yellowstone Creeks on the northern portions of the Spring Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized runoff may cause mud flows and rock slides along these drainages. Roads may become muddy or experience some minor flooding or ponding water. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If you encounter flooding, climb to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft
